work.name: Technicat LLC
work.summary: Providing consulting and contract software development while self-publishing apps and games.

work.name: various
work.summary: Journeyed through the semiconductor, defense, space, computer graphics, mobile Internet, and video game industries.

projects.name: Talk Dim Sum
projects.description: Your dim sum companion. Read about dim sum and learn how to pronounce the dishes. Available on Itch.io and the App Store.

projects.name: HyperBowl
projects.description: Be the ball! A Unity reimplementation of the classic bowling game, licensed from Hyper Entertainment. Available on Itch.io, Steam, and the App Store.

projects.name: Cinefex iPad Edition
projects.description: An iPad reader for the Cinefex visual effects magazine, with extras such as videos and image galleries. Kept it up and running over the march of iOS evolution, fixing, updating, and optimizing in-app purchases, user interface, video...

projects.name: Learn Unity 4 for iOS Game Development
projects.description: An introduction to game development for iOS using the Unity game engine and an example bowling game (super simple version of HyperBowl).

projects.name: Emo-Ray vs. the Intergalactic Teddy Bears
projects.description: A Playstation Home driving/shooting game with alien invader teddy bears.

projects.name: RC Rally
projects.description: A Playstation Home multiplayer racing game.

projects.name: Blue Mars
projects.description: A 3D virtual world implemented in CryEngine. Supported third-party developers, documented the Lua API and framework for creating minigames on the community wiki (a CryEngine wiki even copied part of it!), tweaked physics, updated Scaleform integration, modified CryEngine to work with Scaleform IME (for localization).

projects.name: Darkwatch
projects.description: A vampire western for Playstation 2 and Xbox. Worked on various HUD elements, PAL support, demo builds, implemented multiplayer split-screen, added designer-friendly Lua interfaces for audio, health bars, etc.

projects.name: Fugu Games
projects.description: Small games released as webplayers, Mac widgets, and mobile apps.

projects.name: Tech Deck: Bare Knuckle Grind
projects.description: A skateboarding game bundled with Tech Deck figures. Implemented installers, dynamic shadows, video, a build system.

projects.name: HyperBowl
projects.description: A 3D bowling game, rolling in fanciful locations. Took over for the original lead programmer, updated attraction version of HyperBowl for localization, new lanes, optimization, new graphics cards, arcade and PC support.

projects.name: Neomar
projects.description: One of the first mobile web browsers, conforming to the WAP standards. Implemented HTTP proxy for the Neomar WAP gateway, supporting the Neomar mobile web browser on Blackberry pagers and Palm devices. Launched on the Motient service.

projects.name: Leverage for Scheduling
projects.description: Supply chain scheduling software for semiconductor fabs. Managed the group reponsible for installation, XML interoperability, and user interfaces.

projects.name: N-World
projects.description: A 3D modeling and animation package, used for Mario 3D and Gollum. Ported from IrisGL to OpenGL on SGI workstations, then from Irix to Windows NT, all in Franz Allegro Common Lisp (and a bit of C). Manager of core software group (all the libraries - graphics, audio, UI, security...)

projects.name: ORBIS
projects.description: An expert system for submarine simulation. Added multiplayer network capability to support participation wide area networked exercises (donned a submarine uniform and took part in two of them myself).

projects.name: Proposal Entry Processor
projects.description: A syntax-directed Emacs mode used by astronomers and Institute staff to prepare and edit Space Telescope observation proposals.

projects.name: Database Accelerator
projects.description: A computer architecture based on content-addressable memories. Implemented compilers and simulators and simulations for the Database Accelerator and Content-Addressable Parallel Processor.

projects.name: DROID
projects.description: A VLSI layout synthesis tool, used in-house to design new products, running on TI Explorer Lisp Machines. Added optimizations and other improvements, skipped most of the meetings (also an optimization).

publications.name: Learn Unity 2014 for iOS Game Development
